comments:
I did a simple text search in all files in my workspace.  As I was going 
through the results in the Search view (right-clicking and doing a Compare 
With -> Latest From HEAD on each), the workbench crashed.  It seems to happen 
on random files.

I have been able to reproduce this over and over again.

Exception stack trace:

Raising severity.

This is highly annoying.  It also happens when double-clicking in the 
Synchronize view.

Information extracted from the .log file:
- build I20050610-1757
- VM: 1.4.2_04

Could you please provide steps to reproduce the problem ? We've never seen such
a crash and we won't be able to fix it without detailed steps.

I've since moved to 1.4.2_08 and still experience this problem regularly.  I 
don't know what other information to provide.  I'm surprised that nobody else 
has experienced this problem yet.  When I get some time, I'll copy my current 
workspace to another computer and try to reproduce it on there.  Maybe it's a 
combination of a few factors that leads to the bug.  Like having a lot of 
outgoing changes spread over about a dozen projects that are connected to 
different repositories (which I do).

Created an attachment (id=23557)
Found the VM crash log

Perhaps an SWT bug?

(In reply to comment #5)
> Created an attachment (id=23557) [edit]
> Found the VM crash log
> 
> Perhaps an SWT bug?

This looks like a separate bug. Please enter a new bug agains Platform/SWT for
this one.

No, I think this is the correct stack trace.  The crash happens when opening 
the CompareEditor, as is shown in this trace.

It was a different stack trace than the one in comment #0. 
Oh well. Moving to Platform SWT then.

A few people have reported this, or similar, crashes. Unfortunately, none of 
us here on the SWT team have been able to replicate the problem. It is a very 
common operation, and not that many people reporting it, so it must have 
something to do with system setup or maybe other software running, or maybe 
the precise version of the OS, or something. I am marking this as a dup of bug 
69374.

Pratik, can you please have a look at bug 69374 (and its other dups) to see if 
anything looks familiar to you? And then, if you would, please try the 
following (copied from bug 69374 comment 31) to get a JNI trace, which may 
help narrow down where the problem is really occurring:

- open a DOS window
- cd to your eclipse directory
- type (this bypasses the eclipse launcher):
     your_jre\bin\java -Xmx400m -verbose:jni -Xcheck:jni -jar startup.jar

and then cause the crash to happen, and attach the JNI trace (from the DOS 
window) to bug 69374.

Can you also please try Window -> Preferences... Help and check "Use external 
browser". This should prevent the Help system from creating an additional UI 
thread... maybe that is what is causing the instability.

If those 2 suggestions don not prove useful, then we can try creating a debug 
dll for you and for Tom (from bug 100450) to try.

Thanks very much,
Carolyn

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 69374 ***

traces.message: The classfile is not on the classpath
